label: 問屋
対訳語: A whloesaler, usually based in Edo or Osaka.
本: Land and Lordship in Early Modern Japan . Stanford University Press . 1999
説明文: Ton'ya commonly operated within cartel-like associations that sought to limit competition among members and fix consumer and producer prices. In certain cases, wholesalers also participated in government-recognized merchant guilds, or kabunakama  (Also read toiya.) [株仲間]
